quiz.title: Economics: Price Determination, Elasticity, and Market Structure

questions.question: The price of a product is determined in a free market by:
questions.explanation: In a free market, price is determined by the interaction of market demand and supply.

questions.question: When cross elasticity of demand is a large positive number, one can conclude that:
questions.explanation: A large positive cross-price elasticity means an increase in the price of one good significantly increases demand for the other, indicating substitutes.

questions.question: All but one of the following are assumed to remain the same while drawing an individual’s demand curve for a commodity. Which one is it?
questions.explanation: A demand curve shows how quantity demanded varies with the commodity’s own price, holding constant preferences, income, and prices of other goods.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an essential condition of pure competition?
options: Large number of buyers and sellers
Ability of each seller to set price
questions.explanation: In pure (perfect) competition, firms are price takers; they cannot set the price individually—the market sets the price.
